intro: Bunias sibirica, commonly known as Siberian mustard, is a flowering plant native to eastern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are large, lobed, and often hairy. Its yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the summer months. The plant is known for its peppery taste and has been used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop.
